intro: Elatostema obtusum var. trilobulatum, commonly known as the three-lobed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories in tropical and subtropical regions. Elatostema obtusum var. trilobulatum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil conditions.
